string.text: Trader
This experienced stalker goes by the name "Journalist". He is unsociable and reclusive. The only thing that's known about him is that he's looking for something in the Zone.
This stalker is an experienced veteran that been in the Zone for a long time. Rumored to be on the radar.
This individual is former stalker that's been rumored to be a walking corpse now, controlled by some unknown influence.
This individual is an veteran Monolith soldier. This individual is also highly dangerous, so it's best to stay away from him. No detailed information available.
This individual is a militant that's loyal to the Monolith faction. No details available.
This individual is a sniper that's loyal to the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
This individual is a stalker that's loyal to the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
This individual is a well-equipped militant that's loyal to the Monolith faction. No details available.
This individual is a commander of an military assault force. No details available.
This individual is a military stalker who is well armed, well trained, and very dangerous. No details available.
No detailed information available.
This individual is an special forces soldier that's well trained and well equipped. No details available.
Unknown spec ops soldier
This individual is an special forces soldier that's well trained and well equipped. No details available.

A young stalker from the nearly extinct clan known as the "Disciples of Master D," he is a self-proclaimed Tolkien enthusiast. Inspired by the romantic fantasies he devoured in his youth, he ventured into the Zone despite skepticism from seasoned loners, many of whom believed he wouldn’t survive long. Yet, against all odds, this lover of novels has roamed the Zone for years, relying on his remarkable strength and extraordinary endurance to carve out his place in its harsh, unforgiving landscape.

Wolverine of the Blade Clan is a seasoned stalker who has traversed every corner of the Zone. During his long and storied career, he lost the fingers on his right hand to an encounter with an amoeba anomaly near Kopachi.
Mole
Captain Maximenko
Pied Piper

Little is known about this enigmatic figure, and rumors abound. Some claim he’s a former bandit; others insist he’s a counterintelligence officer with the call sign Krysolov. There’s even speculation that he reached the heart of the Zone and wished for the power to command rats, earning him his nickname. One thing is certain - encounters with him are rare, and even seasoned veterans seldom cross his path. Recently, he seems to have vanished entirely, fading from memory as people begin to forget he ever existed.
This individual is one of the participants in the deadly battles in the Arena. No detailed information available.
This individual is an leader of a group of rookies from the Cordon.
Arnie
Garik serves as the guard of the Stalker Bar - or, if you prefer, the Barkeep's personal bodyguard. His past, like his present, remains shrouded in mystery.
Garik
Garik's twin brother. He works as an bouncer at the bar. He is as quiet as his brother.
Zhorik

Neither a saint nor a scoundrel, he knows his worth, and for that, he’s respected among stalkers. Rumor has it he’s hiding in the Zone to escape a dark past. After an encounter with an anomaly left him with a limp, he decided to change his path. He set up a bar near the Duty group, which quietly became the main gathering spot for Zone veterans. The Barkeep now has extensive connections, both within the Zone and in the outside world.
Barkeep
Beast
A Duty member and regular at the Stalker Bar, rumored to have close dealings with Duty's merchant.
Brome

A good-natured, cheerful guy, his only quirk is that he refuses to use anything but a hunting shotgun - and he’s a crack shot with it. Unfortunately, he ran into trouble near the Rostok factory and lost his shotgun, a cherished family heirloom. Now he spends his days hanging around the bar, hoping someone will help him get it back.
Hunter
A mysterious, all-knowing stalker who deals in information at the Stalker Bar.
Snitch

An experienced stalker and dedicated member of the Duty faction, he is an ideological fighter who wholeheartedly believes in Duty’s cause. Considered the top candidate for the group’s next leader, he stands out as one of the few who voluntarily ventures into the deep Zone - areas with intense psionic activity - while managing to maintain a clear and sound mind.
Captain Ivantsov
Sergeant Kitsenko
The Arena owner's bodyguard. Not much is known about his past, but all of it is bad. He hates his brothers.
Lyolik
Baldy

A seasoned military stalker who has explored every corner of the Zone, he found his place within the paramilitary group Duty, quickly earning respect and authority through his extensive experience. His primary role is to procure weapons, ammunition, and medical supplies for the group. Given Duty’s numerous ties to the armed forces beyond the Perimeter, it’s easy to guess who their main sponsor might be. Though he rarely sells his wares to ordinary stalkers, he is known for his kind and gentle demeanor. A passionate collector, his fascination with weaponry goes far beyond mere necessity.
Petrenko
Chief of Duty's territory security.
Plichko
An unidentified man who has suffered significant mental damage after exposure to a 'brain scorcher'.
Ryaboy

Voronin, a seasoned Zone veteran, is the leader of the paramilitary group Duty, whose primary mission is the destruction of the Zone. He first entered the Zone as part of the infamous initial armed forces expedition, which ended in a disastrous failure. For several years now, he has commanded Duty with an iron hand, enforcing strict discipline and demanding absolute compliance from his subordinates. Due to numerous assassination attempts by mercenaries, Voronin rarely leaves his office these days. Securing an appointment with him requires strong connections within the Zone.
Voronin
Alkash
This individual is a unknown stalker of questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
This individual is a unknown stalker of questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
This individual is one of the leaders of the bandits. Well armed and very dangerous. No detailed information available.
Greyhound
This person is simply known as 'The Doctor'. Very little is known about this individual.
The Doctor
This unknown individual is a mercenary. Well armed and very dangerous. No detailed information available.
This unknown individual is a mercenary. Possibly well armed and dangerous. No detailed information available.
This individual is a stalker that's part of the Clear Sky faction. He's known for collecting information about the Zone, as well as deciphering encrypted PDA's.
Dushman
This individual is a highly experienced stalker. No detailed information available.
Vasily Petrovich
No detailed information.
This individual is a highly experienced stalker. He keeps his ear to the ground, keeping up with new developments in the Zone.
Zheka Duplet
Kalugin P.I.
This individual is a sergeant that's enlisted in the army. No detailed information available.
This individual is a private that's enlisted in the army. No detailed information available.
This individual is a unknown stalker of questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
Lieutenant Chuguikin
This individual is a lieutenant that's been enlisted in the army for a long time. No detailed information available.
This individual is a captain that's been enlisted in the army for a long time. No detailed information available.
This individual is stalker who has managed to not lose his mind, retaining his sanity even after witnessing the worst aspects of the Zone.
Fanatic

An experienced stalker who entered the Zone several years ago, Fox is known for his resourcefulness and cunning. During a deep raid with his partner, they encountered the military conducting a punitive operation near the old warehouses. In the ensuing firefight, Fox's partner was killed, leaving him with a deep, personal grudge against the military. His reputation among stalkers and traders is mixed - many dislike him for his sly nature. Rumors circulate that he doesn’t shy away from robbing other stalkers, though no witnesses have ever come forward to confirm it.
Fox
This individual is a unknown contractor, possibly heavily armed. No detailed information available.

A rookie stalker who arrived in the Zone just two months ago, he has quickly adapted to its harsh environment. So far, he hasn’t ventured beyond Agroprom, believing there’s plenty to be gained on the outskirts of the Zone. Specializing in artifact retrieval for orders and mutant hunting, he has proven himself skilled at both. A humanist by nature, he prefers to steer clear of both the military and bandits, avoiding unnecessary conflict whenever possible.
Petruha

A legendary stalker, known for his unparalleled knowledge of the Zone, he’s said to be able to guide you to any location within it. His services don’t come cheap, but it’s not just about the money - he refuses to work with anyone he doesn’t like, no matter the price. A true veteran, he knows the Zone inside and out.
Guide
This individual is a sergeant that's enlisted in the army. No detailed information available.

A stalker who has earned the nickname Quick due for his knack for being both inconspicuous and indispensable. Traders often rely on him for delicate tasks—tailing someone, keeping watch, or discreetly eavesdropping.
Quick
This individual is a major that's enlisted in the army. He commands the checkpoint at the bridge and he's also known for taking a toll from stalkers, letting anyone pass through if they pay.
Major Kuznetsov
This individual is a conscripted solider that's enlisted in the army, having the rank of private. No detailed information available.

This individual is a special forces operator that's enlisted in the army. Highly trained and well equipped. No detailed information available. (start here for your first session on 1/28/25 and don't forget to remove this reminder when you start)
Unknown Mercenary. Well armed and very dangerous. No details available.
Rookie. New to the Zone. No details.
Just a stalker.
Tolik
Commander of the patrol of the Cordon zone.
Commander

He's been in the trade since he was a kid. In kindergarten sold colored pencils. At school he sold chewing gum. At the institute, he sold light narcotics. When the Zone came along, he realized there was a good way to make money. He is famous for being able to establish good trade relations with the most diverse customers.
Toad
Enjoys a certain authority among the bandits in the Zone. Borov's accomplice.
Vasya Kaban
Stalker of the Duty faction. No detailed information available.
Officer of the Duty faction. No detailed information available.
Prapor
Rookie. Taking his first steps in the Zone.
Yurik
Experienced stalker. Fishing for artifacts on the Garbage.
Sprout
A rookie. New to the Zone. No detailed information available.
Stalker with a dirty face and no less dirty biography.
Witcher
Experienced stalker. No detailed information available.
A militant of the Duty faction. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.
Commander of a special forces unit of Duty group. Usually well equipped.
Skull
A fighter of the Duty faction. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.
Known throughout the Zone as an Informant and informant.
Ara
Unknown Mercenary. Well armed and very dangerous. No detailed information available.
Unknown Mercenary. Apparently new to the Zone. No details available.
Unknown Mercenary. Probably heavily armed. No details available.
Guardian of the Monolith faction. Best to stay away from him. No details available.
Monolith stalker. No details available.
One of the Zone's veterans. This stalker knows the Zone like the back of his hand. Usually well equipped and very dangerous. No details available.
A veteran stalker. Probably well equipped. No detailed information available.
Free stalker. A man who has rallied people around him, ready to die for a common cause.
Kep
Guard for Lukash, leader of the Freedom group.
Freedom's cook. A drunkard and a debauchee, but an excellent cook.
Cook
A well-known mechanic in the Zone. He can build a tank out of a tractor.
Screw
Leader of the Freedom faction.
Freedom leader
Master of the Freedom faction. No detailed information available.
Guardian of the Freedom faction. Fanatically devoted to the faction. Well equipped and very dangerous. No details available.
Chief of Security
Guardian of the Freedom faction. Well equipped and very dangerous. No details available.
Sullen
Kolyan
Tolyan
Stalker of the Freedom faction. No detailed information available.
Freedom sniper. No detailed information available.
Freedom fighter. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.
Freedom Stalker. No detailed information available.
Pavlik
Known for being greedy and unyielding, but they say you can get anything from him.
Freedom Merchant
Stalker of the Freedom faction. No detailed information available.
Crazy Freedom Stalker.
A Freedom Stalker. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.
Sasha White
Veteran stalker. Possibly well equipped. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Elite stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Leader of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Monolith leader
Private stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Monolith special forces stalker. No detailed information available.
Private soldier. No detailed information available.
Zombie
One of the unlucky stalkers.
Zombie
Crowbar
Log
Master of the Duty faction. Very well equipped. No detailed information available.
Scientist. No detailed information available.
Scientist guards. No details available.
Assistant
Assistant
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Monolith militant. Well equipped. No detailed information available.
Army Special Forces. Well equipped. Details unavailable.
One of the Zone's veterans. This stalker knows the Zone like the back of his hand. Usually well equipped and very dangerous. Details unavailable.
A veteran stalker. Probably well equipped. No details available.
Master of the Freedom faction. No details available.
One of the unlucky stalkers.
Lyokha Jawbone's replacement.
Lyokha Jawbone
Veteran stalker. Possibly well-equipped. Questionable personality. No detailed information available.
Employee of a mobile science lab. No details available.

Unlucky lone stalker. Always getting into trouble, rarely getting out of it in one piece. He once lost his eye when he went to the Swamps to retrieve an artifact. Since then, he has been fitted with a prosthetic eyeball instead of an eyeball. Due to a perpetual lack of money, he accepts suicide missions from the Merchants, such as exploring abandoned communications.
Phil

Looter and Murderer. A bounty has been announced for his head on numerous occasions. Was once on good terms with Duty, helped them recapture their current territory. Now dwells in the wilderness and robs lone stalkers with his gang.
Lucky
Doctor of Biological Sciences. Outside the Zone, he studied pathogenic mutations in animals. He went to the Zone to study mutations in blind dogs.
Prof. Kruglov
One of the "heroes" of the Mercenaries. A veteran shot by all calibers. A rare psycho and sadist.
Tyrant
One of Freedom's field commanders. Commander of a squad of fighters who call themselves dogs. An anarchist who despises all laws except those of force.
Wolfhound
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith's special unit Crystal, responsible for the safety of the Monolith itself.
Unknown stalker
Beast
Vasya the Boar
Psychomaterial image.
Hog
Crazy
Prapor
Chief of Security
Skull
Outpost commander
Yurik
Zheka Duplet
Fan
Fox
Gordon
Haron
Imp
Ara
Captain Ivantsov
Stalker Mole
Prof. Kruglov
Major Kuznetsov
Lucky
Petrenko
Zhorik
Prof. Sakharov
Ryaboy
Gray
Cap
Capez
Cook
Screw
Lukash
Freedom Stalker
Pavlik
Scrooge
Sullen
Tyrant
Tolik

This formerly cheerful and cheerful stalker once had the misfortune to fall into a trap set by the religious group Sin. In captivity, he miraculously survived all the unthinkable horrible abuse, which was subjected to, but his will was finally and irrevocably broken. The brainwashing had a strange effect on his behavior: now he was a cold-blooded and brutal killer, incapable of expressing emotions. His fanatical devotion to the group's cause has made him one of the most dangerous people in the Zone.

An enigmatic figure who heads the underground religious group Sin, which has settled in the territory of former military warehouses. Not much is known about his past, but if we believe the stories of stalkers who miraculously survived after talking to him, this is a highly educated man who knows about the Zone almost more than the ecologists from Lake Yantar. This is a sadistic preacher, who is feared even by his "brothers". There is an opinion that he is a mutant created by the Zone itself. The only thing left in him is his body structure. For the head of the leader of Sin appointed a huge reward, but so far none of the stalkers have not been able to get to him - he is protected by his flock.

A longtime stalker. Before the evacuation, he lived with his family in a classified military town in the Zone. He was hired by a research institute to protect a scientific expedition of ecologists from a mobile research lab. Well oriented in the Zone, which has saved his life more than once. Very often visits the bar
Unknown stalker. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
Unknown stalker. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.

Came to the Zone looking for adventure. Looks like a comic book hero from the '60s. He is called different names: Batman, Macho, Black Cloak, Banderos and, although the fact that he has been in the Zone for two years and is still alive speaks volumes, he is still not taken seriously, which hurts him a lot.

Ferocious, angry, rude, selfish, cruel, unfeeling, cold. No one knows when or how he got into the Zone. He is feared and disliked. In the Zone simply lives, he has no future and no past. After one of his many forays into the Zone, he lost his memory and forgot a lot of things. He can't remember where he comes from, he can't remember his real name, he often has memory lapses. For example, he can forget a new acquaintance an hour after meeting him and, having perceived him as an enemy, kill him.
Unknown stalker. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
Unknown stalker. Questionable reputation. No details available.
Guardian of the Duty faction. Unless you are their friend, you should avoid them. Details unavailable.
Duty Stalker. No details available.
A Duty faction fighter. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.

Boor, sycophant, hypocrite, coward. Barin's life credo could be called the phrase "after us there will be a flood". He tries to capitalize on everything. He's very ambitious and resentful. He came to the Zone, as banal as it may sound, for money. And for the second year in the Zone is engaged in the extraction of material values by any means.
A militant of the Duty group. Usually well equipped. No detailed information is available.

He's an official recruiter for the SBU. Often sits in a bar. Everyone knows about it, and also about the fact that if it gets too tight, you should go to him. However, after this step the way back to honest stalkers will be closed.

In everyday life phlegmatic, does not express his emotions, calm. However, with strong impressions, he is irascible, aggressive. Intellectual. Materialist, terribly regrets that he got into the Zone. After graduating from medical school he was sent to the Zone, where the camp of scientists needed an assistant neurosurgeon. He dissects the brains of mutants and studies their psychokinetic abilities. Waiting for a pension and the opportunity to live in the capital city away from this dead place.
One of the unlucky stalkers.
An unknown mercenary. Possibly heavily armed. No detailed information available.
Unknown Mercenary. Possibly heavily armed. No detailed information available.
Unknown Mercenary. Possibly heavily armed. No detailed information available.
Unknown Mercenary. Possibly heavily armed. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No details available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
No detailed information available.
A military stalker. Well armed and very dangerous. No detailed information available.
Private soldier. No detailed information available.
No details available.
Army Special Forces. Well equipped. No detailed information available.
Experienced stalker. No details available.

Incredibly lucky stalker. Many times his group was on the brink of death, and always he was the only one who managed to save himself. Stalkers have a bad reputation as an unlucky talisman. Since some time he's been walking alone.
One of the Zone's veterans. This stalker knows the Zone like the back of his hand. Usually well equipped and very dangerous. No detailed information is available.
A smuggler with a long history.

Ex-Afghan. During one of the mujahideen ambushes, he came to believe in God. After Afghanistan he immigrated to Poland, where he entered the seminary. After graduating from the seminary he preaches for some time in the Lviv Catholic Church. After the explosion at Chernobyl NPP he signed up as a volunteer to help the victims. For the last few years he has been preaching in the Zone.

In the past he was a mechanic at the KholodMash plant. After his wife left him, he decided to commit suicide, and since he was a religious man, he chose the Zone as the original method of suicide. But he survived, wore himself out for a couple of years and gained a certain authority among stalkers, thanks to his professional skills. At the moment the Master is the most competent locksmith in the Zone, repair of equipment and machinery, arrangement of defense systems of group bunkers, etc. etc. etc. - his diocese. He can get into any door, is influential, simple, but rude in communication.

Former military stalker, lieutenant colonel of the internal troops. After one of the operations in the depths of the Zone, he was left alone from the entire squad, but found evidence that they were simply set up and sent for slaughter. After that he decided not to go back, faked his own death and went to the stalkers, to deal with the problem of the Zone illegally. Silent, cynical, determined.
A rookie. New to the Zone. No detailed information available.

Unsophisticated 20 years old. He has nothing and no one left on the Big Land, so he decided to come here. He has nowhere to leave the Zone. In the Zone simply makes ends meet. He owes a lot of stalkers some money. He goes to the Zone very often, but never alone, more often he joins groups of stalkers. But few people agree to take him, because he is just an extra burden. Loot collects very rarely. Lives on handouts from other stalkers and therefore all in debt.
Stalker's a veteran. Probably well equipped. No detailed information is available.
Stalker veteran. Probably well equipped. Detailed information is missing.

Oleg Demon Gusarov. Former Black Beret, served in the Belotserkovsky brigade of Spetsnaz. Senior enlisted, senior sergeant, specialty sniper and bomber. By state of mind - a lone wolf. In the Zone he never takes his partners with him, preferring to act alone. More than once he was offered to join clans, but he always refused flatly for this reason.

A student from the Physics Department, he left the fifth year of the institute to go to the Zone to earn money. He liked to show off his scientific knowledge and argue on abstract philosophical topics. For this show-off he is disliked by stalkers. But in general, the guy is not bad. Still believes in high ideals.

Sparrow's 27 years old. Cunning, far-sighted, but sometimes he makes grave mistakes. Sometimes sneaky. Overall, leaves an ambivalent impression of himself. thin and pale. He came to the Zone out of curiosity and made a promise to himself - two months in the Zone and then home. But he stayed here. On his first foray into the Zone, he managed to walk without devices through a field full of anomalies without knowing about them. When he was informed about it, he could not recover for a long time. Since then he celebrates that day (October 9) as his second birthday.
Master of the Freedom faction. No detailed information is available.
Stalker of the Freedom faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Freedom faction. No detailed information available.
Freedom Fighter. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.

Leshiy, as he was nicknamed by his brother, came to the zone as a young idealist. But a few years of living on the edge of death made him a cynical realist. He considers the zone his home, and those who have not passed the test of the zone - unworthy to live on Earth.
He writes essays and stories about the Zone under the pseudonym Arkady. In the past, a journalist, meticulous, tough, but fair. Enjoys a certain respect among stalkers.
One of the unlucky stalkers.
One of the unlucky stalkers.
One of the unlucky stalkers.
Bandit security guard. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
A common bandit. Questionable reputation. No details available.
Rookie bandit. Questionable reputation. No details available.
Experienced bandit. Questionable reputation. No details available.
Bandit leader.
Borov
Stalker of the Duty faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker faction Duty. Detailed information is not available.
Sergei Shaggy
Stalker of the group Duty. No detailed information available.
Bullet
Private soldier. No detailed information available.
Army Special Forces. Well equipped. No detailed information available.
Experienced stalker. No details available.
Rookie. New to the Zone. No detailed information available.
Representative of Project Awareness.
Representation. Awareness
Ghost

The head of an expedition of ecologists from a mobile scientific laboratory. A world-famous scientist, once interested in natural anomalies in this part of the world, conducts research on the shore of Lake Yantar in his bunker. He is the author of a thesis on "Properties of gamma particles in fields with multidirectional gravitational acceleration". He has been known to send stalkers to their deaths to test artifact-based drugs or technologies.
Sakharov
A researcher in the mobile laboratory. No detailed information available.
Scientist
Scientist
Zombified stalker
Messer
Fryer
Sapyga
Veteran of duty
Prapor
Zob
Ghoul
Scarecrow
Father Diodorus
Master
Polkan
Inept
Oleg Demon Gusarov
Clever
Sparrow
Summoner
Prut
